item.title: Coronavirus: Thousands return to UK to beat France quarantine
item.description: Extra ferry services are laid on as 160,000 holidaymakers see their plans thrown into chaos.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'We're packing frantically' after France quarantine rule change
item.description: Holidaymakers weigh up whether to cut their trip short or face quarantine on return to the UK.

item.title: A-levels: Worcester College 'will honour offers' despite results
item.description: The college says it has confirmed students' places "irrespective of their A-level results".

item.title: Coronavirus: Holidaymakers racing to return to UK and YO! Sushi to cut jobs
item.description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus outbreak this Friday evening.

item.title: Wilson reaches world snooker final in remarkable finish
item.description: Kyren Wilson beats qualifier Anthony McGill 17-16 after an unforgettable final frame to reach his first World Championship final.

item.title: Coronavirus cases stable across most of England
item.description: A survey by the Office for National Statistics suggests fewer than 0.05% of the population has the virus.

item.title: Belarus election: Exiled leader calls weekend of 'peaceful rallies'
item.description: Svetlana Tikhanovskaya tells people not to "stay on the sidelines", six days after a disputed vote.

item.title: Coronavirus: Lockdown to ease further in England from Saturday
item.description: More beauty treatments, small wedding receptions and live indoor shows can resume this weekend.

item.title: US 2020: Biden campaign says Trump 'abhorrent' for fuelling Harris conspiracy
item.description: The Biden campaign issues a scathing response after Mr Trump spreads false information about Kamala Harris.

item.title: Coronavirus: North England Covid-19 restrictions extended
item.description: The number of coronavirus cases has risen and remains high in parts of the North West and Yorkshire.

item.title: Police investigate racist hate crime at British Army base in Cyprus
item.description: Military police are called in after a black soldier finds racist graffiti on his car at a camp in Cyprus.

item.title: M&S customer 'racially harassed by staff member' in Basildon
item.description: Police are investigating an allegation that a woman was abused outside a store.

item.title: Ex-pizza delivery boy's gym firm worth over £1bn
item.description: Ben Francis, the founder of sportswear company Gymshark, is now worth an estimated £700m.

item.title: World War Two code-breaking sisters on Official Secrets Act and wartime memories
item.description: Pat and Jean Owtram signed the Official Secrets Act, agreeing not to talk about their roles - and so kept it from each other for 30 years.

item.title: Quiz of the week: Who was named the world's highest-paid male actor?
item.description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

item.title: Bangladesh: Losing my job as a garment factory worker
item.description: Sonia is one of thousands of garment workers who have lost their jobs in Bangladesh due to Covid-19.

item.title: Students from Georgia school district in viral photo speak out
item.description: Since the photo went viral, nine people from the school have tested positive and hundreds have been asked to self-isolate.

item.title: Coronavirus: Preparing for a post-lockdown musical
item.description: The cast and crew of Sleepless describe the preparations for their ''coronavirus-safe'' production.

item.title: Beirut explosion: Children dealing with the trauma of the explosion
item.description: Thousands of injured, displaced and traumatised children are dealing with the aftermath of the port explosion.

item.title: Lightning pictures: Spectacular storms light up England skies
item.description: Photos from across England show a remarkable lightning show on a stormy Wednesday night.

item.title: 'One cubicle toilet for about 26 of us' - sportswomen speak out
item.description: Almost two-thirds of elite British female athletes have experienced sexism in sport but the vast majority did not feel able to report it. Here, four women share their stories anonymously.

item.title: Exam results: Can I accept a degree place and sit the exam? And other questions
item.description: Are you concerned about your results? Experts answer some of your questions.

item.title: Results day: How do you celebrate one so strange?
item.description: Whether it was happy or sad, Thursday was the end of an era for many students and worthy of celebration.

item.title: 'We were all packed, then they cancelled our holiday'
item.description: Hundreds of would-be holidaymakers are finding their bookings have been cancelled at the last minute.

item.title: The girl who picked up an AK-47 to defend her family
item.description: An Afghan girl was hailed as a hero, but her story was more complicated than it first looked.

item.title: Babyteeth: The teen film tackling cancer with humour
item.description: Its star Eliza Scanlen, says the script had "more life than anything I've read in ages".

item.title: Beirut blast: Picking up the pieces of a shattered city
item.description: The destruction goes for miles, but Beirutis are slowly picking up the pieces in a broken city.

item.title: Mauritius oil spill: Are major incidents less frequent?
item.description: Oil slicks can lead to major environmental disasters but industry experts say regulations are now much better.

item.title: Robots go their own way deep in the ocean
item.description: Firms are building robots that can survey the seabed and underwater structures without human help.

item.title: Rizwan and weather frustrate England in second Test
item.description: England are frustrated by gritty Pakistan batting and more bad weather on day two of the second Test at the Ageas Bowl.

item.title: Wiegman to succeed Neville as England women's boss
item.description: Netherlands women's manager Sarina Wiegman will succeed Phil Neville as England's head coach in September 2021.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the UK travel quarantine rules?
item.description: France and the Netherlands are the latest places from where people must quarantine on arriving in the UK.

item.title: Coronavirus: Can I get travel insurance and what are my travel rights?
item.description: France and the Netherlands have been added to the list of UK quarantine countries.

item.title: Coronavirus: Where can I go on holiday? A guide to destinations
item.description: As people in the UK get the green light to go abroad again, here's a look at what's in store for travellers.

item.title: Coronavirus: Can I get facial treatment at a beauty salon?
item.description: More lockdown rules are being eased in England - how are customers being kept safe?

item.title: Coronavirus in the UK: How many confirmed cases are there in your area?
item.description: Key graphics explaining how coronavirus has spread in the UK and the government's response.

item.title: Coronavirus lockdown: All you need to know about new measures
item.description: How will social and work life be different after the easing of more restrictions?
